intro: Urostigma ingens, commonly known as the giant urostigma, is a striking member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are broad and palmately lobed, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Urostigma ingens is often cultivated for its aesthetic value in gardens and botanical collections.
